home.heroText: Cadence Avocats is dedicated to the servicing of companies by offering a full range of complementary skills.
content: We provide advisory and litigation services in the fields of business law and employment law to VSEs, SMEs and large groups.

Convinced that the profession should not be limited to the provision of legal advice alone, the lawyers at our firm attach great importance to client relationships and to understanding the operational and tactical aspects of all cases.
The firm's modern approach favours direct and straightforward communication with clients.

firm.heroText: Cadence Avocats offers the support you require to deal with all your business law and employment law issues.
content: The size and operational approach of the firm enable us to offer a high level of expertise while still maintaining fees at a reasonable level.
With experience in other highly respected firms, our lawyers offer in-depth expertise in their respective fields, enabling them to provide their clients with bespoke advice of the highest quality.
Ideally located at the heart of the Haut Marais district in Paris, the firm's offices are easily accessible via public transport (Temple, Arts et Métiers and République metro stations).

members.name: Anne-Sophie Wafo-Tapa
description: Anne-Sophie Wafo-Tapa, founding member of Cadence Avocats, is a lawyer and member of the Paris Bar.
She offers advisory and litigation services in all areas of employment law, covering both individual and collective employment law issues.

With the benefit of her six years of experience gained in legal firms specialising in employment law, Anne-Sophie established her own firm, AW Legal in 2017, in order to pursue an independent career. Then, in 2018, Anne-Sophie decided to co-found Cadence Avocats in order to offer her clients a diversified range of services, still within the context of a firm operating on a very human scale.
In addition to a Master in Business Law, Anne-Sophie also holds a DJCE in Company Law and a DJCE specialisation certificate in Employment Law.
She studied for a year at the Cardiff School of Law & Politics and works in both French and English.

members.name: Marie Plassart
description: Marie Plassart, founding member of Cadence Avocats, is a lawyer and member of the Paris Bar.
She offers advisory and litigation services in all areas of business law.
She has developed particular expertise in company law, finance (notably crowdfunding), commercial law and dispute resolution.
After practising for six years at Solferino Associés, Marie decided to become a co-founder of Cadence Avocats in order to offer a wider range of complementary skills.
Marie holds a DJCE diploma in Company Law from Rennes University, a CDS in Corporate Law and an LLM in International Business Law from Exeter University in the UK.
She works in both French and English.
